EcmaScript6 Examples - is

The Object class in EcmaScript 6 brings a new method called "assign" which works with composition. In some JavaScript's libraries there is a feature called "mixin" which extend a class with new methods, in ES 6 it is called "assign".

Let's see an example: 

                
                    let person = {
                        hurt: false,
                        exploded: false
                    };

                    let soldier = {
                        hit: function(target){
                            target.hurt = true;
                        }
                    };

                    let gun = {
                        shot: function(target){
                            target.exploded = true;
                        }
                    };

                    Object.assign(soldier, gun);

                    console.log('Person Hurted:' + person.hurt);
                    console.log('Person Exploded:' + person.exploded);

                    soldier.hit(person);
                    console.log('Person Hurted:' + person.hurt);
                    console.log('Person Exploded:' + person.exploded);

                    soldier.shot(person);
                    console.log('Person Hurted:' + person.hurt);
                    console.log('Person Exploded:' + person.exploded);

In this example the object "Soldier" is extended with a object "Gun", and it makes possible that a soldier firing a shot. An object can be extended by n other objects.
